EntityCreator

Create a GameObject that’s attached to an entity This is done by checking for the entity name in the JSON Source array of GameObjects.

If a GameObject with that name is found the GameObject is created and attached to the entity as Script.gameobject

The GameObject will contain everything defined in the Json gameobject.

Used by

MapHook(entity, obj)

Summary
EntityCreatorCreate a GameObject that’s attached to an entity This is done by checking for the entity name in the JSON Source array of GameObjects.
Functions
create(json)Create an instance for the given JSON Source
process(entity)Processes the entity and create its GameObject

Functions

create(json)

Create an instance for the given JSON Source

Returns

A new instance of the class

Example

-- create and decode the json file
jsonSource = JsonSource:create()
jsonSource:process("MyGame.json")
gameobjects = json:getGameObjects()

process(entity)

Processes the entity and create its GameObject

The entity name must be found among the GameObjects in order to create anything

If the GameObject is flagged as ‘persistent’ it will be stored and reused when loading another map.

Called by Map:Load for each entity loaded You may also call this anytime with a runtime generated entity and obj set to nil.
